act_info.full_title: Supplementary Interim Appropriation for 2019-2020 Act, 2019, S.O. 2019, c. 15, Sched. 36

content.content: 1 Expressions used in this Act have the same meaning as in the Financial Administration Act unless the context requires otherwise.
content.raw_html: 1 Expressions used in this Act have the same meaning as in the Financial Administration Act unless the context requires otherwise.

content.section: Additional amounts to be paid or recognized
content.content: 2 All amounts authorized under sections 3, 4 and 5 to be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses or non-cash investments are in addition to the amounts authorized to be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses or non-cash investments under sections 2, 3 and 4 of the Interim Appropriation for 2019-2020 Act, 2018.
content.raw_html: 2 All amounts authorized under sections 3, 4 and 5 to be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses or non-cash investments are in addition to the amounts authorized to be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses or non-cash investments under sections 2, 3 and 4 of the Interim Appropriation for 2019-2020 Act, 2018.

content.content: 3 Pending the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2020, amounts not exceeding a total of $29,026,709,800 may be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses to be applied to the expenses of the public service that are not otherwise provided for.
content.raw_html: 3 Pending the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2020, amounts not exceeding a total of $29,026,709,800 may be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash expenses to be applied to the expenses of the public service that are not otherwise provided for.

content.content: 4 Pending the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2020, amounts not exceeding a total of $78,494,300 may be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash investments to be applied to the investments of the public service in capital assets, loans and other investments that are not otherwise provided for.
content.raw_html: 4 Pending the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2020, amounts not exceeding a total of $78,494,300 may be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund or recognized as non-cash investments to be applied to the investments of the public service in capital assets, loans and other investments that are not otherwise provided for.

content.content: 5 Pending the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2020, amounts not exceeding a total of $96,594,600 may be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund to be applied to the expenses of the Legislative Offices that are not otherwise provided for.
content.raw_html: 5 Pending the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2020, amounts not exceeding a total of $96,594,600 may be paid out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund to be applied to the expenses of the Legislative Offices that are not otherwise provided for.

content.content:
6 All expenditures made or recognized under this Act must be charged to the proper appropriation following the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2020. 7 Omitted
(provides for coming into force of provisions of this Act). 8 Omitted (enacts short title of this Act). ______________  Français
content.raw_html:
6 All expenditures made or recognized under this Act must be charged to the proper appropriation following the voting of supply for the fiscal year ending on March 31, 2020.

7 Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Act).

8 Omitted (enacts short title of this Act).
